Dashboard

The Dashboard page is your home page and displays a navigation menu, portlets, help and screen options. The menu and portlets can comprise personally configured and system administrator configured options.

Portlets

Portlets are displayed in the central pane and typically display a summary of the available content and links to access that content. {3}

More about portlets...

Navigation menu

The navigation menu is displayed on the left-hand side of the page and provides links for accessing content that include standard EQUELLA links and system links configured by the administrator. The links displayed depend on the privileges granted by the System Administrator.

More about navigation links...

Portlets

  • Move a portlet by dragging the portlet title bar.
  • Show or hide portlet content by selecting the toggle button on the left-hand side of the portlet title bar.
  • Edit the portlet details by selecting the button at the right-hand side of the portlet title bar.
  • Close a portlet by selecting the button at the right-hand side of the portlet title bar.
  • Administer the portlets by selecting Settings from the navigation menu then Dashboard administration.

Back

Navigation menu links

Navigation menu links can include:

  • Standard links — Dashboard, Search, Contribute, Favourites, My resources.
  • Custom links — Administrator configurable links that can be an alternative to a portlet when access to content is required. Add custom links to the navigation menu by selecting Settings from the navigation menu then Edit custom links.
  • Administrator links — Settings, Manage resources.

Back

Select the SCREEN OPTIONS button to add portlets to the dashboard, an example is shown below.

To add an example 'Welcome' portlet to be displayed to all EQUELLA users, complete the following:

  1. Select the SCREEN OPTIONS button to display a list of portlets.
  2. Select the Formatted text option to display the Create portlet page.
  3. Configure the details as required, an example is shown below:
    1. Select to allow users to close or minimise the portlet as required.
    2. Select the CHANGE button to display the Select recipients dialog.
    3. Search for the users, groups or roles then select the OK button.
    4. Enter text in the HTML Editor pane.
    5. Select the SAVE button to display the portlet on the user's Dashboard.

Select an option from the navigation menu to the left to use EQUELLA features.

Select the HELP button to show or hide online help.

When logging in with a System account, Dashboard portlets, HELP and SCREEN OPTIONS buttons, are not enabled for the Welcome/Dashboard screen.

To modify or delete Dashboard portlets seen by non-admin EQUELLA users, choose Settings from the navigation menu then Dashboard administration.

Dashboard administration

The Dashboard administration page provides a portlet search that displays a list of all portlets used on dashboards with associated information.

This page provides for portlet searching, viewing, sorting and filtering results with links to edit or delete a portlet.

  • Search—enter search terms to display matching results.
  • Portlet name—select the portlet name to display the portlet’s edit page.
  • Actions—select an action to perform on the portlet.
  • Filters—refine the search by filtering for criteria.
  • More on search criteria...
  • More on the Filter box...

Search criteria

  • Search — enter search terms.
  • search — select this button or press the Enter key to display items that match the search criteria.

Back

Filter box

The filter box provides options for reducing the number of displayed results. Select the toggle button to maximise or minimise the portlet.

  • Filter by Owner — select the select user button to display the Select owner to filter by dialog where owners can be found by name search then selected to filter the search results.
  • Filter by type — expand the drop-down menu to choose to a specific portlet type, or choose the default option All portlets.
  • Filter by visibility — expand the drop-down menu to choose to view portlets that are viewable to others, user portlets, or all portlets.
